data.title: Best clubs in Ibiza ➡️ a guide to the Top 18 list that you should know ✅
data.meta_description: The ultimate guide to the best clubs in Ibiza 2024, with all tips and latest info. Discover why it's called the Party Island
data.meta_site_name: Ibiza Beach Cruise | Float Your Boat | Ibiza Boat Party
data.text:
Reading Time: 20 minutes

Welcome to our 2023 guide of the best clubs in Ibiza!

Ibiza is a world-renowned destination for its vibrant nightlife and stunning beaches. The island has a magical and multicultural atmosphere, embraced by both the local Ibicencan community and the thousands of tourists who visit each year. From April to October, Ibiza comes alive with a bustling and exciting lifestyle.

When you visit Ibiza, you’ll have plenty of exciting things to do, such as thrilling adventures, day trips, and experiencing the vibrant nightlife that takes over during the summer. The island caters to everyone’s taste, offering picturesque beaches and a wide selection of beach club restaurants.

Dayclubs and nightclubs are the heart and soul of Ibiza’s entertainment scene, drawing visitors from all corners of the globe. As locals who grew up on this island, we are delighted to share with you our list of the 18 best clubs in Ibiza. These Ibiza Superclubs are a must-visit, whether you’re planning your Ibiza holiday in advance or looking to immerse yourself in the vibrant nightlife once you arrive. Get ready to make unforgettable memories and experience the true essence of Ibiza’s nightlife scene.

Check out our : Ibiza opening parties 2023 guide

1. Hï Ibiza Superclub

Hï Ibiza is the newest Ibiza superclub to open on the island, located on the former site of Space (1986-2016).

The modern club is located in the vibrant club strip of Playa D’en Bossa, right at the heart of Ibiza’s nightlife scene. It was officially named the world’s number one club by DJ Mag in 2022, establishing itself as a global benchmark for clubbing. Therefore this club is guaranteed to be one of this summer’s party hotspots, and is most definitely considered one of the best clubs in Ibiza.

Number one club in the world award won in 2023 by the International nightlife association. Followed by Omnia in las Vegas which in my opinion is just a cabaret kind of show.

From top-notch resident DJs to state-of-the-art design and innovative sound technology, every detail is crafted to put you at the center of the action. With its advanced technological features, Hï Ibiza is leading the way in shaping the future of club culture worldwide. The outside garden of Hï Ibiza features unique tree like structures that reminds of Singapore´s Gardens by the bay.

Hï Ibiza is a symbol of the highest standards of music and visual entertainment on the island. Bringing world-class music and technologic experiences to a club designed with the dancer in mind. This club showcases the most exciting names in electronic music throughout the summer. From the biggest stars in the commercial EDM scene, to the leading artists of the underground. Hï Ibiza continues the island’s legacy as the party capital of the world.

Capacity

With a 5500 capacity, this Ibiza superclub has 2 main rooms. The larger of the two called the club room, and the smaller side room called the theatre room. Hï Ibiza even offers a DJ in one of the main bathrooms, called the wild corner (yes it does get wild in there). Some of its famous parties are Glitterbox, Martinez Brothers, Armin Van Buuren, Afterlife, David Guetta Fuck Me I´m Famous and Black Coffee.

Prices

Expect to pay between €50 and €80 for parties at Hï Ibiza. Drink prices align with the typical rates on the island: a beer costs around €16, a bottle of water is approximately €13, and long drinks range from €20 to €23. You can also get a 5 drink pack for €85 (saves €10).

Good to know

The dress code is bit more stict than other venues in Ibiza. Nothing compared to any other place in the world, just don´t rock up wearing flip-flops, a soccer jersey or a sleeveless vest. There is an ATM inside the club and don’t bring your selfie stick as it’s not allowed.

Location

Platja d’en Bossa, 07817, Balearic Islands, Spain. Keep in mind that parking in Playa D’en Bossa may be limited, especially during peak times, so it’s advisable to arrive early or consider alternative parking options.

“Hi” is a small word that can be the beginning of a meaningful conversation, or the start of a beautiful friendship that can lead to a bigger world of discovery. “Hi” is a welcome to a new era in Ibiza.

Hï Ibiza will be open even sooner this year, 27th april, not much info out yet, just an email to keep you updated when tickets will be available

Hï Ibiza and Ushuaïa in 2023 will open on the 29th of april. Ushuaia daytime and Hï at night. The perfect Combo.

The line up released is a big one, superstar Djs like the Martinez Brothers, Loco Dice, Maceo Plex, Eric Prydz, Black Coffee, Adam Beyer just to name a few.

Tickets are available here.

2. Ushuaïa Ibiza Superclub

Ushuaïa Ibiza is one of the top Ibiza superclubs, located across the street from Hï Ibiza.

Opened in 2011, Ushuaïa Ibiza holds daily parties from 5:00 pm until midnight throughout the summer season. If you want to listen to music at all hours and enter a sophisticated environment full of bikini clad partygoers, Balinese beds, and huge LED screens, Ushuaïa Ibiza is the club for you.

Parties not be missed: CALVIN HARRIS, ANTS, EL ROW, BIG.

Many celebrities such as Neymar, James Blunt, Paris Hilton, Naomi Campbell have been seen at Ushuaïa Ibiza.

In addition, Ushuaïa Ibiza offers accommodation at its club and tower hotels. This convenience is perfect if you wish to enjoy the Ibizan party atmosphere throughout your stay.

Prices

Depending on the party the prices vary from €50 to €90. As for drinks, a beer is priced at €16, a 0.5L bottle of water is €13, and long drinks typically range from €20 to €23. If you’re in a group, you can take advantage of their special offer: buy 5 shots, beer, or long drinks and get 6, or buy 10 and get 13.

Location

It is located on the beach of Playa d’en Bossa. Ctra. De Platja d’en Bossa, 10, 07817 Sant Jordi de ses Salines, Illes Balears, Spain. You can get there by taxi from Ibiza (€ 10 – €15) or by bus from the center of Ibiza.

3. Amnesia Ibiza Superclub

Amnesia Ibiza is considered one of the three best clubs in Ibiza, and is par with Ibiza superclub excellence. In 2007 Amnesia received the award for the best club in the world. This award was given by the prestigious International Dance Music Awards.

If you’re looking for a variety of parties with style, Amnesia Ibiza is the club for you. From their famous underground parties with marathon DJ sets, to their more commercial EDM nights. All of these parties are highlighted by the Ibiza superclub magnificent production of Co2, lighting, and lasers.

Amnesia Ibiza is also well known for their foam parties running for more than 20 years.

The best Ibiza DJs (Sven Väth, Carl Cox, Marco Carola, Paul van Dyk …) all have had residencies here.

These celebrities have been seen making appearances at Amnesia Ibiza: Paris Hilton, Leo Messi, Cristiano Ronaldo, Valentino Rossi, Mick Jagger, Shakira and Elsa Pataky, just to name a few! It is not only the meeting point of many celebrities, but also to anonymous people who want to listen to the energetic music provided at this Ibiza superclub throughout their holiday.

The party not to be missed at Amnesia Ibiza is Paradise with Jamie Jones (2022 Full Lineup TBC).

Prices

Party prices range from €35 to €80. For drinks, long drinks are priced between €20 and €24, while beer ranges from €12 to €15, and a 500ml bottle of water costs between €9 and €10. Please note that the bars upstairs generally have higher prices compared to other areas.

Location

Ctra. Ibiza a San Antonio, Km 5, 07816 Ibiza, Balearic Islands, Spain.

You can get to its facilities by car, taxi or bus from the center of Ibiza.

4. Ocean Beach Club Ibiza

Opened in 2012, Ocean Beach (O Beach) is one of the only clubs to hold outdoor day parties in San Antonio. It might not be part of the Ibiza nightlife but it sure goes off here!

O Beach is located on the west coast of this municipality. Where you can enjoy its magnificent bay views and spectacular sunsets. O Beach as it is typically referred to holds “the best Pool Parties in Ibiza” with an elegant touch where you will be able to enjoy good music and a great party vibe. It’s a must-visit spot for those seeking to enjoy champagne showers, premium vodka from magnum bottles, and the ultimate relaxation on VIP beds or dancing in the pool under the Balearic sun.

Featuring a diverse lineup of daytime parties, the music at O Beach Ibiza spans from uplifting House beats to timeless dance classics, with some events featuring deeper rhythms and live performers. What sets this resort-style venue apart are its captivating sky shows, featuring acrobatic performances that take place at various times throughout the afternoon.

Monday: D4 D4NCE

Tuesday: Kisstory runs from 9 May to 10 October

Wednesdays: House In Paradise runs from 17 May to 4 October

Ed Sheeran’s impromptu performance at House In Paradise in August 2022

Thursdays: ON111 runs from 11 May to 5 October

Fridays: Pool Party runs from 12 May to 13 October

Saturdays: Soul Heaven runs from 13 May to 7 October

Prices

It depends on the party, but you can attend from as low as €15 on some of the parties that take place, depending on the calendar.

Location

Carrer des Molí, 12-14, 07820 Ibiza, Illes Balears, Spain.

It is 15 minutes walk from downtown San Antonio. You can get there on foot or on any bus that goes to this municipality. You can also take a taxi from Playa d’en Bossa or Ibiza (€20 – €25) or from San Antonio (€5).

5. DC-10 Ibiza Superclub

DC-10 Is the most underground of the best clubs in Ibiza. Known for its famous party called Circoloco, and New Years Day events which are quite popular with the locals. DC-10 is renowned to be one of the best clubs in Ibiza when it comes to techno. You won’t see much marketing or publicity of it´s famous Circoloco parties.

This true ibiza experience lies next to the airport runway, the planes landing overhead is always part of the excitement at DC-10. This club opened in 1999 and has a significantly different approach than the other clubs on the island.

It has gained its devoted following, so be sure to check this club out if you like DJs like Solomun, Jamie Jones, Seth Troxler, Carl Cox, Tania Vulcano, Paco Osuna, Adam Beyer, Tale of Us, and Adam Port.

Prices

Prices typically range from €50 to €60. However, it’s important to note that prices may be higher for special events such as the opening, closing, or anniversary parties.

Location

Carretera las salinas, km 1, 07818 Sant Josep de sa Talaia, Illes Balears, Spain.

Taxi fares from Ibiza Town or Playa d’en Bossa to the club will cost approximately €16, while the fare from San Antonio will be around €32. If you prefer taking the bus, there is a stop just past the club for easy access to Salinas beach. Another option is walking from San Jordi, which takes about 15-20 minutes to reach the club.

6. Pacha Ibiza Superclub

You will hardly find a club as successful and legendary as Pacha Ibiza. This world famous brand of nightclubs was owned by a Spanish family who founded it on the mainland of Spain in 1967. They opened Pacha Ibiza in 1973 and recently sold to an international conglomerate in 2016. It is easy to recognize this Ibiza superclub Pacha Ibiza by the mythical cherries of the logo. Also by the parties that are offered to the delight of the attendees. Famous for its sexy house music and electric vibes.

Pacha Ibiza held some of the most popular and longest DJ residencies over the years. Famous DJs like Solomun, Erick Morillo, Roger Sanchez, Swedish House Mafia, Pete Tong, and Bob Sinclair have all held longstanding residencies here. Of course we can´t forget F*** me I’m Famous, which was created by Cathy and David Guetta, or Defected created by Simon Dunmore.

In Pacha Ibiza, you have the musical options from its Main Room, Funky Room, Global Room which used to feature Hip-Hop and R&B, and even hits from the 80s and 90s in the Sweet Pacha room. You will also have access to a roof terrace where you can enjoy cocktails under the moonlight.

The most famous parties in Pacha Ibiza over the years are F*** me I’m Famous, and Flower Power which has been running since the club opened its doors! A big update is the move of Marco Carola´s residence Music On. 2023 signifies the remarkable 50-year milestone of Pacha’s legendary legacy, characterized by its influence in music, glamour, and the global clubbing scene.

Prices

Prices vary from €30 to €90, depending on the party. As the island gets busier and the parties grow in popularity, prices tend to increase. Expect to pay around €12 for a bottle of water, €14 for a beer, €16 for a Corona. Shots start at €11 and for €21 you’ll get a long drink.

Location

Av. 8 d’Agost, 07800 Eivissa, Illes Balears, Spain.

Taxi €10 from Ibiza Town, €15 from Playa d’en Bossa, €30 from San Antonio. You can also walk from Ibiza town in about 10 – 15 minutes, and there are disco buses which circulate throughout the night in high season.

7. Privilege Ibiza (TEMPORARILY CLOSED)

Privilege will not open in 2023! There is a big lawsuit going on with Matutes regaining control.

Privilege Ibiza was once awarded as the largest superclub in the world, and has a capacity of more than 10,000 people. It is paradise for lovers of techno and house music. Famous for all night parties, its sunrises while the music still is playing, its pool in the center of the dance floor, and the immensity of its main room. This enormous World Guinness record superclub has many rooms, terraces and even a pool.

Resistance has put this club back in the highlight with a world class lineup such as Carl Cox, Adam Beyer, Sasha, Loco Dice, Nic Fanciulli. If you want to live a unique experience, and you like techno music and macro parties, this is your club. The biggest club in the world.

Best Party: RESISTANCE (party created by the Ultra Music Festivals brand).

Prices

Tickets vary in price depending on the party, from €30 to €50. You have the option of going on the disco bus or free buses from Playa d’en Bossa beach or San Antonio if you have already had your ticket.

Location

Urbanización San Rafael, s/n, 07816 Sant Antoni de Portmany, Balearic Islands, Spain.

Privilege is situated in San Rafael, halfway between San Antonio and Ibiza Town. Taking a taxi from San Antonio or Ibiza Town to Privilege typically costs around €15-€20 and takes approximately 15 minutes. The journey may take slightly longer if you’re coming from Playa d’en Bossa.

8. Eden Ibiza Superclub

Eden Ibiza is a nightclub of considerable size. Its capacity of 5,000 people says it all. Founded in 1999 in San Antonio Bay, the club was completely renovated in 2013. In addition to the large main room, it also offers a smaller side room which boasts a unique sound thanks to the Void Incubus Gold soundsystem. Eden has two VIP areas, private parking, several levels, and many bars that serve cocktails of all kinds.

House music and techno are the protagonists at Eden Ibiza. Big names who have played at Eden range from the Disclosure brothers, to Pete Tong, Markus Schulz, Ferry Corsten, Dubfire, and Camelphat, etc.

Prices

It tends to be slightly cheaper to head to a superclub in San Antonio. You can expect ticket prices here to be between €25 – €40. Eden´s busiest night is back, Defected will on every Friday from 29th April till 30th September for €25.

Location

Carrer Salvador Espriu, s/n, 07820 Sant Antoni de Portmany, Illes Balears, Spain.

Eden Ibiza is a few minutes walk along the bay from the center of San Antonio. It is also about a 5 to10 minutes walk from San Antonio’s main bus station. From there buses run to and from Ibiza Town, or from Playa d’en Bossa during night hours only. Alternatively, a taxi will be around €20 – €25 from Ibiza town.

As of December 2023 not much info is out yet but what we know is not much will change from 2023 by the looks of some of the opening dates confirmed.

9th May – One More Time

25th May – Mon Cheri

26th May – Abode

4th June – Outset Ibiza

4th July – SHINE

9. Lío Ibiza Superclub

Lío Ibiza is a cabaret restaurant, also now known as a gastro club. It might sound strange to include Lio into this list, but its nightly cabaret performances are world famous.

This venue is a true Ibiza classic when it comes the white island´s nightlife. It used to be called El Divino, which was one of the best clubs in Ibiza for many years.

We have been a fan of the epic nights it used to hold with Roger Sanchez Release Yourself, Louie Vega and Barbara Tucker´s Ibiza nights over the years. However, the interior of the venue still goes off as a nightclub after dinner hence why it´s in our list.

One of the best located out of all the Ibiza superclubs, Lío Ibiza stands in the beautiful harbour of Marina Botafoc. Situated in between some of the biggest and baddest multi-million Yachts moored in the marina. Lío Ibiza has the most incredible view of Dalt Vila from its restaurant and terrace areas.

The interior club opens after dinner and the cabaret show finish, which is around 1am until dawn. If you prefer to visit Lio Ibiza for only some dancing you can still purchase a ticket for just the club area. One of the more expensive nights out on the island. You might be sitting next to someone famous like Leo DiCaprio, Michael Jordan, or Neymar Jr. Therefore this upmarket gourmet gastro club is a good choice if you don´t mind the price.

Prices

At Lío the minimum spend value per person is typically around €150. However, it’s important to note that prices at the nightclub can vary depending on the specific date and event happening at the club.

Location

Passeig Joan Carles I, 1, 07800 Eivissa, Illes Balears, Spain.

Lío is situated in Talamanca, which is just a 20-minute walk from Ibiza Town. If you prefer taking a taxi, the fare from Ibiza Town to Lío will be approximately €10, while it will cost around €30 from San Antonio.

10. Cova Santa Superclub

Cova Santa as the name says in spanish, is built on top of a cave in the southwestern part of Ibiza.

Owned by Amnesia since 2001, Cova Santa is also well known in the recent years for its big afterparties for Marco Carola´s Music On, Hyte, and many more. This club has creeped its way up our list, especially during 2017-2019 with its famous party called Woomoon.

The restaurant at Cova Santa used to be famous for its live flamenco shows. Now it offers tables with views from their terrace of the stage and dancefloor below.

Prices

Ticket prices for Cova Santa typically range from €25 to €35, with variations based on the specific promoter hosting the event.

Location

Ctra. San José, km 7 (desvío Sa Caleta), 07817 Ibiza, Spain.

This venue is between the airport and San José (Sant Josep de Sa Talaia). On the road towards Sa Caleta and Cala Jondal. The most convenient way to reach Cova Santa is by taxi, with fares typically ranging from €18 to €22 from Ibiza Town, €15 to €17 from Playa d’en Bossa, and €22 to €27 from San Antonio.

11. Ibiza Rocks

It might be weird to consider this as one of the best clubs in ibiza as it’s more of a pool party venue. Ibiza Rocks has held some amazing parties over the years. We have danced in this venue to Prodigy, Florence and the Machine, Kooks, and Nas. Also DJs such as Swedish House Mafia, Carl Cox, and Calvin Harris have performed there. Due to local town hall regulations this venue has refocused to amazing weekly pool parties featuring Craig David or Cuckoland.

The location of the Ibiza Rocks pool party is right in the heart of San Antonio with more than 20 years in the making.

Prices

Expect to pay between €15 and €40 depending on event. Entree is free if you are a hotel guest. Beers are €7, water €4, mixer €10.

Location

Avinguda del Doctor Fleming, 6, 07820 Sant Antoni de Portmany, Illes Balears, Spain.

Only a 10 min walk from San Antonio bus station, and between €25 and €30 by taxi from Playa d’en Bossa.

Official opening weekend will be 4th and 5th of May and the promoters will start 28th of May ( Ibiza Anthems ) , 29th April ( Applebum ), 7th June (Joel Corry) , the biggest one Craig David starts late in the summer, 1st of august as well as Ben Hemsley 6th August.

12. Octan Ibiza

Located in Playa den Bossa, this underground club opened in 2019. It was formally know as Sankeys and Kiss before that. This 1500 capacity underground rave like club is a raw and unique experience. Octan features 3 rooms including the new terrace, rocking the new Void Soundsystem. This dark club is always been know for its worker parties such as Viva Warriors with Steve Lawler.

Prices

It’s one the cheaper clubs in Ibiza with prices around €20 and €30. You can find even cheaper wristbands entrances. However if you lay on the beach at Playa d’en Bossa for an hour or two you might be offered free entrance.

Location

Carrer de les Alzines, 07800 Eivissa, Illes Balears, Spain.

Octan is a 27€ taxi ride from San Antonio and €12 from Ibiza town. You can also take the nightbus to get there which goes every €30 and €60 min from San Antonio.

13. Es Paradis, San Antonio

This iconic pyramid shaped club might not be the best club in Ibiza, but it sure is one of the most beautiful ones. Es Paradis opened its doors in the 70´s and was an open air club at that time. It had a roof installed by the 90´s due to the loud music.

This roman – garden style club is famous for its iconic Water party, Fiesta del Agua. How we miss those days. Es Paradis offers a diverse range of music genres to cater to different tastes, ensuring there’s something for everyone. While they occasionally explore specialized genres, they primarily focus on keeping the music accessible and enjoyable for casual clubbers. Many of their nights feature radio-friendly dance hits, as well as familiar tunes from genres like Hip-Hop and R&B that resonate with a wide audience.

Prices

Es Paradis offers a more affordable option compared to the super-clubs, with party tickets ranging from €25 to €40. During the peak season, water is priced at €6, beer at €8, and a spirit and mixer can range from €13 to €20.

Location

Carrer Salvador Espriu, 2, 07820 Sant Antoni de Portmany, Illes Balears, Spain.

It located besides Eden, literally 5 meters away, next to the San Antonio Harbour. How to get there: Es Paradis is walking distance from the San Antonio bus station, and is a €25 taxi fare from Ibiza town.

14. Underground Ibiza

Although Underground Ibiza is not widely recognized by tourists on the island, it is certainly a well-known spot among us locals. It is not the biggest venue, but this nightclub still made our list with its reasonable drinks prices and great music. Underground Ibiza has good lineups of local DJs, and the occasional international artist. You won’t see Underground splashing all over social media or going crazy with promotions, and that’s what makes it so cool. It always has a cozy vibe and a crowd that knows their stuff.

Prices

Normally with no admission fee and a more intimate vibe. You can expect to pay a maximum of €10 for beer and other drinks at Underground Ibiza.

Location

Diseminado Cas Arabins, 96, 07816 Sant Antoni de Portmany, Illes Balears, Spain.

This club is located between Privilege and San Rafael, in the center of the island of Ibiza

.

15. Swag Ibiza

Not a fan of techno? Swag Ibiza is a different kind of venue compared to the rest of the best clubs in Ibiza. This is an urban, R&B, Reggaeton and Hip Hop nightclub. Swag opened it´s doors back in 2014 and has a capacity of 1000 people. It shares its club with the modern Hotel Garbi and has urban parties 7 days a week.

It celebrates Black music in all its diverse forms, including Reggaeton, Hip-Hop, Dembow, and even a touch of electronic beats. If you dance to a different drum and want to experience Ibiza in your own rhythm, SWAG is the place to be. Get ready to move and groove to the most bass-heavy rhythms in Bossa.

Inside the club, you’ll find two VIP zones that can accommodate up to 1000 people. If you’re looking to elevate your experience, you have the option to upgrade and indulge in the VIP treatment, where you can finally unleash your inner baller.

Prices

The ticket prices are around €25. The average price of a spirt and mix drink is between €20 and for a beer you pay around €12.

Location

Carrer de la Murtra, 5, 07817 Sant Josep de sa Talaia, Illes Balears, Spain.

SWAG is conveniently located in the heart of Playa d’en Bossa. You can easily reach the venue by taking a taxi, which will cost approximately €32 from San Antonio or €16 from Ibiza Town (refer to taxi fares). Alternatively, you can hop on the disco bus for a fun and affordable transportation option.

16. Club Chinois (former Heart Ibiza)

Heart was one of the best clubs in Ibiza over the past decade. Ran by Ferran Adriá (creator El Bulli, best restaurant 3 yrs in a row) and Cirque de Soleil founder Guy Laliberté. It is a great gastroclub located in the golden mile in Marina Botafoc. This was a fancy dinner and after show type of venue whitin the 5 star big hotel of Ibiza Gran hotel.

Club Chinois, an exclusive nightspot that takes you back to the charm of Asian cabaret in the 1920s. With its velvety atmosphere, dazzling sequins, and the allure of black silk, this venue brings to life the inspiration of 1920s Shanghai. At Club Chinois, you can enjoy captivating performances by international headliners and live shows encompassing various musical genres.

Please note that Club Chinois has a dress code policy requiring men to wear long trousers, maintaining an elegant atmosphere throughout the venue.

Prices

Club Chinois offers a more affordable experience compared to the super-clubs, with party tickets priced between €25 and €40.

Location

Passeig Joan Carles I, 17, 07800 Eivissa, Illes Balears, Spain.

A taxi ride from Ibiza Town costs approximately €11, while from Playa d’en Bossa it is around €16, and from San Antonio, it’s approximately €32. If you prefer taking the disco buses, they conveniently operate all night and will drop you off directly at Pacha, which is located just a street away.

17. Pikes Ibiza

Pikes Hotel Ibiza is has a long history on the island. With swanky parties and lots of dancing into the night, Pikes is another iconic Ibiza venue. Some interesting facts about Pikes: Ibiza Rocks took over this hotel back in 2011. In the early ’80s, Pikes underwent a transformation from a 500-year old finca to a luxurious hotel, thanks to its founder Tony Pike. It quickly gained fame as the “Chelsea Hotel of Ibiza,” attracting A-list celebrities such as George Michael, Grace Jones, Boy George, and Freddie Mercury, who sought it out as a hideout and vibrant party destination. George Michael´s Wham even filmed the famous Club Tropicana at this venue.

They host fantastic residencies like DJ Harvey’s Mercury Rising, Pikes On Sundays, Homies, and the incredible annual Halloween costume party. Pikes offers more than just nightlife. You can enjoy a delicious Sunday roast, have fun with bathtub karaoke, join a yoga class, or simply relax with a drink and take a dip in the pool. Pikes is a place where you can experience it all.

Prices

At Pikes, parties typically offer free entry, but you’ll need to apply for guestlist directly through their website. A beer costs €12, Water €9 and a spirit and mix drinks €18.

Location

Camí de Sa Vorera, S/N, 07820 Sant Antoni de Portmany, Illes Balears, Spain.

The taxi fare is usually under €10 from San Antonio and around €35 from Ibiza Town, making it a convenient and affordable option to get there.

18. Akasha, Las Dalias

Nestled in the famed hippy haven of Las Dalias in the northern part of the island, Akasha club brings a fresh and thrilling energy to Ibiza’s nightlife scene. Akasha, which openend its doors in 2021, is one of Ibiza’s newest clubs.

With its stylish aesthetic and atmospheric lighting, Akasha exudes a cosmopolitan vibe that wouldn’t be out of place in cities like London, Berlin, or Tokyo. It offers a much-needed late-night dancefloor option for those in the northern region of the island. Led by creative director Igor Marijuan, the club has already welcomed a diverse lineup of talented DJs and live performers from around the world.

Prices

Pre-sale tickets €15 to €20. Please note that online tickets are always €5.00 cheaper than at the door. A beer costs between €6 to €8, cocktails range from €10 to €18.

Location

Carretera San Carlos, Km. 12, 07850 Sant Carles de Peralta, Islas Baleares, Spain.

Akasha is located just before the village of San Carlos, north of Santa Eulalia. From Santa Eulalia, a taxi ride will cost you around €11 to €16, while from Ibiza Town it ranges from €32 to €37, and from San Antonio it’s approximately €43 to €48. If you prefer to drive, there’s a spacious onsite car park available at an affordable rate of around €3 per vehicle.

Bora Bora Ibiza

Bora Bora is no more, this legendary beach club, a great warm up for Space Ibiza in the old days, has been demolished in February 2023.

Started back in 1982, after 40 years of party, this venue will be transformed into a high end dining and beach club experience.

—————————————

In conclusion, Ibiza’s vibrant club scene is a haven for music enthusiasts and partygoers from around the world. From iconic venues like Pacha and Amnesia to hidden gems like Underground and Club Chinois, the island offers an unparalleled nightlife experience. Whether you’re seeking cutting-edge electronic music, live performances by renowned artists, or intimate underground vibes, Ibiza has something for everyone. So, grab your dancing shoes, immerse yourself in the pulsating beats, and let the rhythm of Ibiza carry you into unforgettable nights. Cheers to the best clubs in Ibiza and the endless memories they create!

We hope you’ve enjoyed our tips about the best clubs in Ibiza.
